Still Free TC follows the brothers over two years to explore how they ended up on such different paths, and watches as those paths converge again in a fight for clemency and self-discovery.
results.title: Still Free TC

results.overview: A true-crime documentarian and her trusty crew investigate a small-town tragedy that’s faded into memory as a national joke. As her determination to uncover the truth becomes more and more intense, her methods become less and less ethical—until they become dangerous.
results.title: A Bloody Mess

results.overview: Rob Ford scandalized Canadian politics as the brash yet beloved mayor of Toronto — until an infamous video of him smoking crack sparked his downfall.
results.title: Trainwreck: Mayor of Mayhem

results.overview: Stains and Snow are fleeing from the police when they seek refuge in the dingy flat of Boothy, a desperate addict, and his friend Patrick. As the young men navigate the dangers of their environment, they find themselves in a web of drug operations and their ruthless handler, Frank.
results.title: Trapped

results.overview: The film tells the true story of Carla Antonella Rodríguez, the first female miner in a region of Argentina where women were forbidden to work in the mines. For there was a superstition that women could cause a collapse and mining work was reserved exclusively for men. But, as a trans woman, she entered the mine, breaking the system from within and igniting a social revolution.
results.title: Miss Carbón

results.overview: SWEAT IT OUT! charts the rise and fall of the iconic Australian music scene, affectionately dubbed ‘Oz Rock’.  It’s the story of ambition, power and passion. Of the bands that succeeded, and those that didn’t.  It’s a tale of oversized, colourful characters who risked it all – and the legion of fans who joined them on their journey, sweating it out in the tiny inner urban pubs, massive outer suburban beer barns and jampacked provincial hotels.  It’s the story of a country forging its identity through music and an ethos of bands that toured longer, drove further and played harder to be heard. When bands would play live seven nights a week, sometimes playing three gigs in one day – sometimes even playing three gigs, in three different states, in the one day!
results.title: Sweat It Out!

results.overview: Two individuals bound by the chains of immortality, influenced by an existence beyond human comprehension—whom continuously oversees them for millennia, trapping them in a game of time and the unknown.
results.title: Reversal

results.overview: A 40 years old unknown actor, Ho-jun, runs a fishing YouTube channel. The day after he fails an audition, he goes to a fishing spot to shoot YouTube videos. There, he bumps into director Nam and actress Hee-jin, who has already been cast in a leading role. Three small fries are wandering in the reservoir.
results.title: Small Fry

results.overview: Why clouds? Why make an Andy Warhol Inspired Film? Because Dorkzy has nothing better to do with his life.
results.title: Clouds, An Empire-Inspired Film

results.overview: On that familiar night, a sense of anxiety and fearful emotions came over me. Countless thoughts and questions followed.
results.title: Paranoid Kid

results.overview: A group of underground rap scene kids from South Florida work together to try to become famous rappers but struggle internally with personal issues regarding home life, growing up and their relationship as a group.
results.title: Jit

results.overview: Upcoming Nigerian release
results.title: UNCLAIMED

results.overview: Two artists in Walthamstow set out to take their street off the grid, kickstarting a solar-powered energy revolution.
results.title: POWER STATION

results.overview: In May 2024, news of a murder in the Polynesian nation of Samoa rocked the Pacific. The perpetrator, Sia Figiel, was a trailblazing novelist and poet who won international acclaim for being the first to write about the difficult realities Samoan girls and women face. The victim was her friend, who was also a poet.
results.title: Before the Moon Falls

results.overview: Komt Wel Goed is an intimate, raw and human film about two young adults who are stuck in life in completely different ways. Saar is confronted with sexism and gender equality in the workplace on a daily basis, while Mark struggles with mental problems after losing his best friend to suicide. When they unexpectedly get stuck in an elevator together, a special encounter occurs.
results.title: Komt Wel Goed

results.overview: Screen adaptation of Viktor Tikhomirov's book "Evgeniy Telegin and others. A poem in prose", built on the author's memories of meetings, events and moments from his life. Childhood impressions merge with memories of walks in the Summer Garden, accompanied by thoughts of Pushkin, rehearsals of the Aquarium group, and conversations with Sergey Kuryokhin and Viktor Tsoy.
results.title: Eugene Telegin

results.overview: A movie that’s set to come out in 2025 directed by Ty Guldeman.
results.title: Coats

results.overview: A singer’s voice—and identity—evolve in this raw, lyrical journey through gender transition, loss, and self-discovery. British artist Dylan Holloway, formerly known as Lots Holloway, stepped away from the spotlight during the 2020 lockdown to begin his gender transition. Once a rising star on the UK’s X-Factor, Dylan now faces a profound personal and professional crossroads: hormone therapy could irreversibly change the voice that once defined his career. Blending candid video diaries, family footage, and intimate interviews, Tomorrow’s Too Late traces Dylan’s early life, his struggle with identity, and the emotional toll of life lived in public. At once a music documentary and a deeply moving portrait of trans experience, the film captures the courage it takes to risk everything in pursuit of an authentic self.
results.title: Tomorrow's Too Late

results.overview: For Ahmad Joudeh, a stateless refugee from Syria, dance is not a choice, it’s a lifeline – etched onto his very skin with the words “Dance or Die.” Having defied war and family disapproval to join the Dutch National Ballet, Ahmad found sanctuary in the Netherlands, becoming a UNHCR and LGBTQI+ Ambassador. But haunted by the trauma of his past, he makes a perilous decision: to return to Syria for the first time since the war, risking everything to bring the healing power of dance to a community still ravaged by conflict.
results.title: The Dancer

results.overview: Looking back on her first pregnancy, a woman navigates the echoes of a life-changing loss.
results.title: Before You

results.overview: A young boy, James, suffers from the loss of his late brother. After neglecting support from others, James must come to his senses by being forced to battle something which has been haunting him for a lifetime.
results.title: Hidden Within

results.overview: American Idetics generates on demand videos featuring the viewer--and there's something very wrong with Moira's videos.
results.title: Sweet Dreaming

results.overview: Three student filmmakers set out to capture each other's inner life struggles in an avant-garde documentary, but as the lens turns inward and time begins to lose meaning, they drift into an existential spiral of insanity—where memory fractures, selves unravel, and nothing remains quite real.
results.title: Untitled Mockumentary Comedy

results.original_title: 인피니트 15주년 콘서트 리미티드 에디션 더 무비
results.title: INFINITE 15TH ANNIVERSARY CONCERT 'LIMITED EDITION' THE MOVIE

results.overview: 10-year-old Vladik is a genius of neural networks and a master at getting rid of nannies. When his mother urgently needs to go on a business trip, he has to go to the village to visit his grandfather, whom he has never seen in his life. Vladik dreams of returning to the city and getting into an important IT competition, and his grandfather has no intention of following his lead. Each of them is sure that they can easily outsmart the other, but this meeting will change them both.
results.title: На деревню дедушке

results.overview: The winner  of a regional women's darts final suspects her opponent of letting her win, and won't let her leave until she finds out why.
results.title: One Hundred and Eighty

results.overview: When Phoebe goes missing, Mari takes it upon herself to find her. With an old friend’s help, they uncover a sinister website linked to the kidnapping, forcing Mari to confront her past to save Phoebe before time runs out.
results.title: Sugarcane

results.overview: An observation of daily life from the perspective of a cinema employee together with the imagination and power of cinema.
results.title: Kino

results.overview: Jeff Minter has remained an extraordinary independent video game developer in an industry dominated by corporations. Heart of Neon maps Jeff's unique career and the shifting landscape of the video game business, and shines a vivid light on the bond between artist & audience that has sustained Jeff for four decades.
results.title: Heart of Neon

results.original_title: Di Sarno: The Story of Emilio’s Ballato
results.overview: If you walk down Manhattan’s Houston Street, you probably won’t notice this restaurant — unless you wonder what all the people are standing in line for. It’s famous, yet most people have never heard about it.
results.title: Di Sarno: The Story of Emilio’s Ballato

results.original_title: Di Sarno: The Story of Emilio’s Ballato
results.overview: If you walk down Manhattan’s Houston Street, you probably won’t notice this restaurant — unless you wonder what all the people are standing in line for. It’s famous, yet most people have never heard about it.
results.title: Di Sarno: The Story of Emilio’s Ballato

results.overview: New father Adam visits his estranged dad, Paul, in a bid to reconcile a painful past. But as buried memories and resentments surface, the day spirals into a raw confrontation neither is ready for.
results.title: Withhold

results.overview: A young woman working as a rider is forced to make a dangerous delivery that will put her life at risk during a night filled with urgent personal problems that she must solve through phone calls.  Millions of people make a living as riders around the world, Fio’s story of redemtion is but one of them.
results.title: Rider

results.overview: Andrew Finch relives a dinner with the Fargo's, as his fragile memories make it challenging to uncover the truth about that night.
results.title: Dinner Scene

results.overview: Struggling rapper Cmills is desperate to help his mother overcome addiction while facing life's challenges. When she's diagnosed with cancer, he must decide: give up his music to support her or pursue his dreams to honor her legacy through his songs.
results.title: Feel My Pain

results.overview: A powerful record of grief, community and ceremony in which the renowned Indigenous actor is laid to rest on his Homeland of Gupulul in Arnhem Land, NT.
results.title: Journey Home, David Gulpilil

results.overview: Julia and Tobias discover that their daughter Marielle has suddenly developed telepathic abilities and can see and hear everything they do. This leads to situations ranging from the awkward to the absurd as uncomfortable truths are revealed.
results.title: What Marielle Knows

results.overview: As a child, on the eve of March 8, Vitya was hit on the head by a swing and miraculously survived. Since then, three of his friends celebrate this date every year as their friend's second birthday. But this time, the fun goes too far. The guys wives and girlfriends will have to save them from problems and the consequences of a protracted party.
results.title: Качели

results.overview: The Road to Patagonia is a stunning, intimate and unflinching series of love letters within a documentary – firstly, a love between two people, and secondly between humanity and the Earth. Ecologist Matty Hannon begins an incredible solo adventure, to surf the west coast of the Americas by motorbike, from the top of Alaska to the tip of Patagonia. But deep in the wilderness - alone with the wolves and the bears - the journeyer’s plans unexpectedly fall to pieces. After losing everything, and on the cusp of quitting he meets the girl of his dreams, a permaculture farmer named Heather. Shot over 16 years, the result is an adventurous exposé on the more-than-human-world, offering a physical and spiritual odyssey to better understand our place in Nature.
results.title: The Road to Patagonia

results.overview: When her car breaks down in the remote countryside, Eve stumbles upon three alluring fortune tellers whose tarot reading reveals a fate far darker than she ever imagined.
results.title: Coven

results.overview: In the fictional country of Magorigan, where autistic people have just been segregated from society and the workplace, a creative autistic individual named Sora Altair must join a group of special secret agents to save the world from a bomb.
results.title: Spectrum Syndicate

results.overview: A young filmmaker is determined to know her neighbours in the port town of Folkestone. But in the aftermath of Brexit, building new relationships isn’t easy.
results.title: Blue Has No Borders

results.overview: Leah is haunted by fragmented memories and crushing guilt. As she descends into a dark psychological journey, the lines between reality and her troubled past blur, forcing her to confront the chilling truth that has begun to consume her.
results.title: The Guide

results.overview: The Crackers return for one final outing. Will they win? Will they survive? We genuinely don't know.
results.title: Crackers: Folie à Trois

results.overview: Filmed at the Paradise Rock Club in Boston, the hour is produced by Bill Burr of All Things Comedy. “The first time I saw Steph Tolev was a promotion video she made for a New York City show. I Immediately fell in love with her and her Comedy. One of the most uninhibited original voices out there today. I love everything about her!”
results.title: Steph Tolev: Filth Queen

results.overview: A British story of dissent, drawn from the frontlines of climate resistance. Through the experiences of those who stood in defiance, it traces the quiet unraveling of our protest rights. The film challenges audiences to question what makes dissent effective and where the line of acceptability is.
results.title: The Line We Crossed

results.overview: After the successful release of African Kung Fu Nazis part I; are you ready for the crazy whacked-out continuation in part II. This time hated villain Adolf Robotler reappears and wants to become President & Reichskanzler of Ghana with the help of his henchmen. But something seems off with Adolf; some think he is a robot, also In his way are local Kung Fu hero Addo (younger brother of Addae from part 1) and his sidekick Sek Tin. Together they embark on a quest to learn new Kung Fu styles, take out Hitler’s henchmen and finally face the master of evil himself. But the two heroes will encounter a “monstrous surprise”…
results.title: African Kung Fu Nazis II

results.overview: Young boxer Arlan, a trainee at the Olympic Reserve Boxing School, dreams of making it to the Olympics. However, he is forced to take on side jobs to support his mother and younger brother, who suffers from a rare illness.  One day, while working at a store, he meets Alina, a piano student at the conservatory who secretly dreams of becoming a singer. Their meeting inspires her to gain the confidence to choose her own path.  As his brother’s condition worsens and expensive treatment becomes necessary, Arlan, following the advice of his friend Tokha, agrees to take part in underground bare-knuckle fights to earn quick money — sacrificing his dream of Olympic gold.  Now, he must endure a grueling journey through the brutal world of underground fighting, where the reigning champion is the undefeated Nikita Aday.
results.title: Arlan: The Final Round

results.overview: Shannon Sadler faces a parent’s worst nightmare when his 18-year-old daughter, Mattie, goes missing over the Christmas holiday. An intense investigation ensues, and the determined Detective Truely takes on the case. Her main lead becomes Mattie’s boyfriend after he’s found covered in blood. But it soon becomes evident that there is more to the story than initially thought, and as Detective Truely sorts through the evidence navigating the twists and turns of the case, it slowly spirals out of her control. Meanwhile, with Shannon knowing that his daughter’s life is at stake, he decides that he has no choice but to take matters into his own hands. Leaning on his military past to do what is necessary, will Shannon find his daughter, or will Detective Truely solve the case before another life is taken?
results.title: Reverence

results.overview: Choreographer and performer Jenn Freeman has always possessed the gift of movement. From a very early age, she simply had to dance… all the time. But with that ever-present need to jump, leap, shake and squirm came a struggle to exist harmoniously in a world that seemed to assault her senses and sense of equilibrium at every turn.
results.title: Room to Move

results.overview: Dream or Reality !  Two lost souls meet in strange ways through various fragments of dreamlike memories. As we delve into their complicated relationship and their story unfolds, their relationship seems to disintegrate, leaving us to wonder if it will survive this reality or dream.
results.title: Ode To Oblivion

results.overview: For seven years a certain boy wizard went to a certain Wizard School and conquered evil. This, however, is not his story. This is the story of a certain girl wizard in the Puffs… who just happened to be there too. A tale for anyone who has never been destined to save the world.
results.title: Puffs: Filmed Live Off CHSHS

results.overview: A young couple get married with high ideals and hidden pasts. An intimate exploration of traumas and how to negotiate shame, anger and love.
results.title: Love & Trouble

results.overview: After refusing a flower delivery, Regina’s cat disappears, unraveling her sense of reality. As strange encounters accumulate and familiar faces grow unrecognizable, she’s forced to confront unsettling truths about her mother, her memories, and herself. Regina is a surreal mystery about loss, identity, and the quiet collapse of control.
results.title: Regina

results.overview: After lighting up and getting the munchies, a group of vulgar teenage girls stumble into a botched robbery at their local convenience store.
results.title: Munchies

results.original_title: Spiritus: No Business Like Dough Business
results.overview: Highlighting the rich history of one of the oldest and beloved family-run businesses in Provincetown—Spiritus Pizza is a local gem and iconic late-night gathering spot. Featuring homespun interviews with owner John Yingling and many former employees, SPIRITUS explores the challenges faced by the business, the queer community and the AIDS crisis, all against the backdrop of changing attitudes in the town during the 1970s and ’80s. Since its founding in 1971, and through the ensuing decades, Spiritus has remained a vibrant epicenter of activity, resilience, and deeply-rooted history in Provincetown—as well as a slice of pizza heaven!
results.title: Spiritus: No Business Like Dough Business

results.overview: 39-year-old Anni involuntarily has to move back in with her mother after a scandalous incident on live children's television. It looks bleak for the single, broke and homeless soon-to-be 40-year-old, but is it all that bad after all?
results.title: Home

results.overview: During an excursion in a nature reserve a few kilometers far from crowded beaches and chaos, Erion finally finds the courage to tell Christian that they will never have to see each other again.
results.title: Erion

results.overview: Following the disappearance of his best friend, a boy is haunted by a ghost who speaks in a language he cannot understand.
results.title: The Deafening Sound of Silence

results.overview: This vibrant documentary explores Long Island's indelible impact on hip-hop's evolution, told through the voices of pioneering artists who shaped the genre. The suburban landscape inspired a distinctive sound that expanded hip-hop beyond NYC, while also challenging the false promises of suburban utopia.
results.title: The Sixth Borough

results.overview: Cece’s Interlude follows the journey of a young transgender woman unexpectedly facing pregnancy, as she navigates addiction, unstable relationships, and the daunting prospect of motherhood, ultimately raising questions about identity, resilience, and the complexities of parental responsibility.
results.title: Cece’s Interlude

results.overview: Kelsey honors her late mother by training for a marathon and sharing her journey online. Her posts attract Billy (Keenan Tracey), a grocery worker caring for his disabled mother, Debbie. Obsessed, Billy kidnaps Kelsey and hides her in their attic, controlling her for years. When Debbie discovers the truth, she and Kelsey must fight for survival.
results.title: Girl in the Attic

results.overview: Vera is a young woman trying to cope with her life, plagued by a violent relationship, when she suddenly receives terrible news: her best friend has been murdered.
results.title: Encrucijadas

results.overview: The concept of hunting plays a major factor in the story of the film, with multiple people hunting each other, both figuratively and literally.
results.title: Mrigaya

results.overview: A melancholic yet heartfelt story of the former singer of pop band Black Lace and his journey on the road with his aging mother and his partner, as he aims for a comeback.
results.title: Still Pushing Pineapples

results.overview: A documentary about Colorado fly fisherwomen and their relationship with the river and its inhabitants, the sport, and their identities.
results.title: Fly Chicks

results.overview: Young kid dragged into a life of crime by viciously corrupt politician and business man "Sebastian October". Tangled in a web of lies the protagonist "Dominic" does everything he can to live a normal life but keeps getting pulled back into the life he so desperately wants to leave.
results.title: Fall To Pieces

results.overview: The story of how Mark came to be the Approval Minister in Moth, and the story of the early stages of the government within the original film.
results.title: Cocoon: A Moth prequel

results.overview: LaptopGirl goes on a quest to save Felicity The Triangle Lady.
results.title: The Burger City Brawl

results.overview: During an amateur shoot directed by PUNK, one of the world's worst directors, a person wearing a lip mask kills the film's actresses one by one, until one is left. We discover that the killer is filming his murders, for the ultimate project.
results.title: Director's cut

results.overview: In the distant future, the human race has lost their home planet and is now ruled by an alien empire from an alternate dimension. On the capital planet of Vyrkeln, a human searching for their family is pulled into a conflict decades in the making by an underground resistance, while the empire's deadliest agents hunt them across the planet.
results.title: Terra: Reignition

results.overview: Formidable grandmother Isla Roberts is adamant. She insists that although she’s not a lesbian, her girlfriend Susan is. In this tender, richly humorous portrait of an 87-year-old horse carriage driving champion, we learn what makes an ordinary life extraordinary. Straight-shooting Isla’s lived experience of rural Australia, raising a family in severe economic hardship, and finally coming out later in life, all make for a poignant documentary of a woman who’s well ahead of her time and refuses to be put in a box. Director Marion Pilowsky tracks Isla for an eventful, cathartic year with empathy and incisiveness.
results.title: Isla's Way

results.overview: Jeeti and Koko's romance faces family opposition, but their battle for acceptance becomes a struggle to stay alive.
results.title: Jombieland

results.overview: The lives of three boys: Finn, Ellis and Kai before, during and after rehab.
results.title: Green Jumper

results.overview: Post Truth is the first feature-length documentary generated entirely using artificial intelligence. It explores our relationship with technology and examines how we arrived at a world where truth and reality no longer matter. The film, documents an era of endless information overload and cultural dissonance, using the very language of the era it reflects. Self-reflexive by design, it invites viewers to critically reconsider their perception of reality.
results.title: Post Truth

results.overview: A drama with touches of suspense, where a mother and daughter get lost in a cave.
results.title: The Cave

results.overview: A short film following a lost and weary traveler as they come face-to-face with the monstrous warden of the cursed woods and a deadly bargain with which they must contend.
results.title: The Traveler & The Troll

results.overview: 4 pretty close friends went to Big Bear Lake for a winter getaway. They thought summer was going to be a movie, and it was, but like not the genre they thought it was going to be. The teens were never seen again... woah
results.title: Big Bears Bite

results.overview: When Emilý, a twenty-five year old content creator, learns that her long-distance girlfriend wants to move to Iceland and make their open relationship exclusive, she must face her anxieties about the future. All the while trying to support her teenaged co-worker and battle financial difficulties.
results.title: Skinny Love

results.overview: Some men are literal dogs! And Juan happens to find one in the wilderness while on vacation. He takes him in, bathes him, feeds him, and shows him much-needed affection. However, his girlfriend warns against becoming too attached…
results.title: Perro perro

results.overview: Emerging from a wild, working-class dreamscape of friendship, fame and fuzzy guitars, this is the story of six Wirral teens who became The Coral and shook the British indie scene.
results.title: Dreaming of You

results.overview: In an era defined by climate crisis and the ongoing coronavirus pandemic, a group of individuals embarks on a mission to sow the seeds of a controversial plant. They initiate their farming venture in Paju, near the border between North and South Korea, attracted by hemp's ecological benefits and its potential to foster peace. However, they soon face significant obstacles in a country where hemp is classified as an illegal drug. Those who require hemp for medical purposes, along with its advocates are criminalized as the plant itself is. In a nation that has declared a war on drugs, no one associated with hemp remains untouched by the shadow of illegality.
results.title: Pull

results.overview: Witness 90 years of the ‘Steel City’, captured on film, reflecting the people, changing places and the unique identity of Sheffield.
results.title: Sheffield on Film

results.overview: T.J. Oshie became a household name after his electrifying shootout performance against Russia at the 2014 Sochi Olympics—a defining moment of grit and national pride that captivated the world. But behind the glory of a Stanley Cup and raising a family lies a deeper battle, one fought off the ice
results.title: Coach

results.overview: PIEOWA: A PIECE OF AMERICA celebrates the myriad ways pie is woven into Iowa’s culture, the lengths people will go to for a slice, and how this humble pastry can bake the world a better place.
results.title: PIEOWA: A Piece of America

results.overview: Resilience and destiny shape Raunak's path and keep her spirits up against all odds.
results.title: Raunak

results.overview: Resilience and destiny shape Raunak's path and keep her spirits up against all odds.
results.title: Raunak

results.overview: Between February and April 2025, filmmakers Bernard-Henri Lévy and Marc Roussel filmed the Pokrovsk and Soumy fronts in eastern Ukraine, following the fighters of the Anne de Kyiv Brigade, armed by France. They filmed the daily lives of the inhabitants, bombarded by Russian forces terrorizing civilians on the eve of possible negotiations. They interview President Zelenskyy, who is reluctant to travel to Washington, and then watch the rebroadcast of the meeting with Ukrainian soldiers in a bunker. For the real heroes are the anonymous fighters and civilians who hold their heads high in the face of adversity and suffering, and who are filmed on a daily basis. The final part of Lévy’s “Ukrainian Quartet”, Our War is a diary, peppered with flashbacks in which the author recalls the high points of this war that began in 2014.
results.title: Our War

results.overview: Upcoming short film
results.title: In The Wake Of Compunction

results.original_title: An Hour from the Middle of Nowhere
results.overview: One of the largest immigration detention centers in the United States is located in a remote location with no close-by private immigration attorneys other than Marty.
results.title: An Hour from the Middle of Nowhere

results.overview: In 1970, an eccentric young stripper named Shelly Baumann loses her leg in a freak parade canon accident, then uses her settlement money to open 'Shelly's Leg' disco - one of the nation's first and most consequential openly gay spaces.
results.title: Shelly's Leg

results.overview: Soon, there will be wolves everywhere in France again. People have to learn to cohabit with them.
results.title: Living With Wolves

results.overview: In an alternate universe, a homeless superhero must navigate the harsh realities of society while battling the growing homelessness crisis in Australia, fighting for justice in a world that has abandoned him.
results.title: Spiderman Homeless

results.overview: Maria Valenzuela is lead conductor of the Guadalajara Philharmonic. She aspires to be recognized internationally. Challenged by the presence of a young and new conductor who just arrived.
results.title: Ceremony

results.overview: A nice romantic dinner in a restaurant goes awry when it’s revealed one of them has a monstrous secret.
results.title: The Fling

results.overview: A documentary celebrating the life of Fernando Estrella, a pioneering LGBTI activist and beloved cultural icon. Through testimonies from friends and collaborators, it traces his fearless advocacy, artistic brilliance, and deep impact on queer visibility in Spain—from the Movida Madrileña to his influential presence in Palma. A chef, performer, and actor in Almodóvar’s films, Estrella defied norms and built community, especially through his legendary restaurant, Flexa. The film culminates in the surreal and moving farewell party held just before his death in 2023, a testament to the love he inspired.
results.title: Estrella, cometa, satélite y planeta

results.overview: It's the eighth original special in Hulu's comedy initiative, Hularious. “Fans call her 'Mother,' but Atsuko is 'Father' — thriving professionally yet clueless about basics,” reads the logline.
results.title: Atsuko Okatsuka: Father

results.overview: Through organised 'mass trespass' events, the Right to Roam movement sets out to increase public access to nature, but finds itself in conflict with England's landowners.
results.title: Our Land

results.original_title: Trạng Quỳnh Nhí: Truyền Thuyết Kim Ngưu
results.overview: Adventures of Quynh and his group of friends, along with a mysterious water buffalo.
results.title: Legend Of The Golden Buffalo

results.overview: Louisville, Kentucky is the home of the glitterball, and after a body is found in a basement of a Victorian mansion, two lovers accuse each other of committing murder. What follows is an exploration of a toxic relationship in a town where ghosts and secrets don’t always stay buried.
results.title: Murder in Glitterball City

results.overview: A look back at the years leading up to the fall of Kabul and the perilous evacuation of civilians trapped inside the embassy in the hours following the Taliban's takeover of the country.
results.title: Kabul Chaos

results.overview: A quiet morning turns unsettling when a young woman begins to question what or who is really inside her home.
results.title: The Other

results.overview: Abdullah Gaza or usually called Gaza is an orphan boy. His father, a humanitarian volunteer, died after returning from Palestine. Since his father's death, Gaza has been placed in an orphanage managed by Ustazah Dewi and his sister Rafah Shafira. There, Gaza met Hayya, a little girl from Palestine who had lived for four years and was trying to find peace in this country. The genocide in Palestine prevented Hayya from returning to his homeland. At the orphanage, Gaza and Hayya's relationship gradually became close. For Hayya, the presence of Gaza is like a cure for longing, considering that its name is similar to the land of his birth. Their lives became cheerful again, complementing each other, until a bad incident came back and threatened their lives.
results.title: Hayya 3: Gaza

results.overview: Different street and historical signs in Philadelphia
results.title: SIGNS

results.overview: Fresh out the depths of the Underworld, Orpheus stumbles on a providential fisherman. The peasant helps him to get well and afterward, the talented poet proceeds to tell his story...
results.title: Orpheus

results.overview: When a group of friends hit a custodian on the road, their consciences may get the best of them.
results.title: One by One

results.original_title: Út Lan: Oán Linh Giữ Của
results.overview: After her father's death, Lan (Phương Thanh) moves to a rural village and becomes a housemaid for Mr. Danh (Mạc Văn Khoa) — a widower with no children. But the moment she steps into the house, Lan is confronted with eerie phenomena and a string of mysterious deaths. With the help of Sơn (Quốc Trường), a horror novelist, she begins to uncover terrifying secrets and the dark history buried within the house.
results.title: The Guardian Demon

results.overview: In 2044, a middle-aged gay man finds himself ageing out of the Manila rave scene. A chance encounter with a mischievous ex-lover changes the tune of his last dance.

results.overview: An overly ambitious paperboy delivers newspapers at the dawn of the most important day in human history.
results.title: ...post

results.overview: For the launch of ‘Operation Sunbird’, a new channel of inconvenient truths about Israel and Palestine, Indya Moore, Rain Dove and Heydon Prowse posed as real estate influencers to gain access to the Israeli realtors, hoteliers and developers making a killing from real estate and tourism on Palestinian land.  The documentary follows Rain Dove on their Aliyah journey from undercover filming at a New Jersey Property Expo to the Occupied West Bank. Aliyah is the right of anyone with Jewish ancestry to resettle in Israel. Rain doesn’t identify as Jewish, and the land isn’t in Israel (it’s in Palestine), but having a Jewish great-grandfather and a big deposit can make all those problems disappear, and qualify Rain for official tax breaks and special mortgage assistance from the Israeli government.
results.title: Stealing Sunset

results.overview: War has ravaged the Ukrainian city of Bucha, whose residents have endured unimaginable hostility and suffering. If hope remains a faint glimmer, the will to survive still shines through in this powerful and unflinching film.
results.title: Shards of Light

results.overview: A fake TV series intro, for a show that never existed. The show "STREET MAN" follows two washed-up ex-cops—fired from their jobs, who are boozed-up, and banned from driving— they roam the city streets on foot, determined to bring down the very criminals they once swore to protect them from. But there’s one big problem: the police chief. He wants them off the streets—permanently. To him, they’re not heroes. They’re vigilantes and liabilities!
results.title: STREET MAN

results.overview: "Traslados" is a compelling documentary that investigates the notorious "Death Flights" conducted during Argentina's last civic-military dictatorship (1976-1983). Through powerful testimonies from former detainees, victims' families, and experts, along with archival footage, animations, and emotional recreations, the film pieces together the intricate puzzle of evidence that confirms the regime's brutal methods of murder and forced disappearance. Key moments featured include the discovery of the body of French nun Leonnie Duquet, the infiltration of military officer Alfredo Astiz into the Madres de Plaza de Mayo group, and an interview with Nobel Peace Prize laureate Adolfo Pérez Esquivel. The documentary also highlights the significant event of a plane used in the "Death Flights" returning to Argentina in 2023, serving as a poignant reminder of this dark chapter in history.
results.title: Transfers

results.overview: Slick Rick's "Victory" is a thrilling visual album that will keep you on the edge of your seat. Set in the heart of London, this gripping 25-minute film stars Idris Elba and Nas, bringing a cinematic twist to Slick Rick’s iconic storytelling. With stunning visuals and an intense, suspenseful plot, Victory blends rap and film in a way you’ve never seen before.
results.title: Victory

results.overview: When Irma recieves a marriage proposal on her 40th birthday, an unexpected chain of events begins that leads Prosper, her family and friends to celebrate in Georgia. But instead of a glittering celebration, they find themselves dealing with conversion tests, gambling, debt, unexpected journeys and instant theats. As chaos reigns and solutions run out, the big question remains - will the wedding actually happen?
results.title: The Wedding - The Revelry 2

results.overview: After recently separating from her husband, Anna embarks on a solo adventure. Using WanderNest, a home exchange website, she swaps homes with Aurora in Greece. Anna is toured around by Aurora's charming handyman Niko, and a romance quickly ensues. However, her perfect getaway takes a turn as mysterious incidents and dark secrets gradually unfold.
results.title: A Home to Die For

results.overview: A comedy about a hookup between twentysomething twink Andy and a mysterious hunk he meets on the dating app Strangr — with some... out-of-this-world consequences.
results.title: Space Daddy

results.overview: "Is cancer a gift?" This unsettling question drives Bowie TSANG, a well-known TV host and speaker active in Taiwan, Hong Kong, and China, on a six-year journey of exploration. Since 2018, as cancer impacted her loved ones and even her trusted doctor, Bowie sought answers on how to face the disease. Through her Vlog, she documented inspiring stories, exploring not only conventional Western treatments but also alternative therapies such as traditional Chinese medicine, integrative mind-body practices, and more. Along the way, Bowie discovered a profound perspective—gaining peace through a "medicine for the mind." Her journey invites viewers to rethink the connection between life, illness, and healing.
results.title: Dear Black Sheep

results.original_title: Le retour du Gendarme de Abobo
results.title: Le retour du Gendarme de Abobo

results.overview: After a tough divorce, Lena enters into a throuple with glamorous couple Iris and Dean for some fun. But when Iris is murdered, all eyes are on Lena. She fights to prove her innocence, but is the real killer closer to home than she thinks?

results.overview: Maria Rita is in charge of keeping in with Our Lady Holy Mary’s altar, replacing its candles and flowers. She breaks the statue by accident. Fearing getting caught, she throws the broken pieces into a nearby well.  The next day, the inhabitants of the village gather to look for the statue, following the path that Maria Rita has taken the night before.

results.overview: It's the eighth original special in Hulu's comedy initiative, Hularious. “Fans call her 'Mother,' but Atsuko is 'Father' — thriving professionally yet clueless about basics,” reads the logline.

results.overview: A documentary celebrating the life of Fernando Estrella, a pioneering LGBTI activist and beloved cultural icon. Through testimonies from friends and collaborators, it traces his fearless advocacy, artistic brilliance, and deep impact on queer visibility in Spain—from the Movida Madrileña to his influential presence in Palma. A chef, performer, and actor in Almodóvar’s films, Estrella defied norms and built community, especially through his legendary restaurant, Flexa. The film culminates in the surreal and moving farewell party held just before his death in 2023, a testament to the love he inspired.
results.title: Estrella, cometa, satélite y planeta

results.overview: A visually dynamic short film , inspired by a poem, that tackles the pressure of unrealistic expectations and social media's impact on self-identity, urging viewers to reflect on their mental health and the small changes needed to reconnect with what truly matters.

results.overview: The documentary will feature interviews with contemporary theorists and practitioners who will share their insights on the concept of a chair.

results.overview: A young man is obsessed with the idea of creating his own cheese, but he fails. By chance, the guy finds out that there is a farm where you can make cheese professionally. However, mice living on the farm stand in his way.

results.overview: Dealing with the loss of a loved one, Riley begins to torment themselves. Grappling with the guilt, they begin to change. Something is haunting them, and they must figure out what before it's too late.
results.title: ALL THE ANGELS

results.overview: Rick is a teenager who doesn't feel happy in his body and decides to lose weight by running.
results.title: Ricky

results.overview: With graduation just around the corner, Lily Chen, who's dreaming of becoming a novelist, is working hard to beat procrastination. As she juggles between reality and her dreams, the big question is: can she finish her novel and step confidently into the next phase of her life?
results.title: I'm Still Kind of a Daydreamer

results.overview: This is a coming-of-age story set in a closed-off rural area in the Heisei era, depicting the summer spent by Mishima Futoshi, who has just realized his identity, and the boys around him. Mishima, who was bullied by his classmate Kirino Makoto, made it a daily habit to secretly apply lipstick and wear women's clothes. One day, he witnesses Kirino trying to apply lipstick to his lips that he had lost.

results.overview: When a hacker hired by a mysterious entity discovers that there is more than one party interested in the task he was assigned, not only will his job be at risk, but also his life.

results.overview: Ella wants to move out. Taylor does not take this well. Talk Shit is a queer campy dark comedy thriller about the worst friendship breakup ever.

results.overview: In electric, personal, and historical ways, this riveting documentary explores whether there is, or ever was, a home for Queer in the hyper-masculine, black painted worlds of heavy metal, punk and rock & roll. Excavating the often-veiled queer lives of some of the greatest culture-defining disruptors and masterminds of music in the 1960s and 70s, Rock Out demands to know what unique value ‘gay’ brought to creating and revolutionising rock, punk, and metal – from the perspective of managers, producers, artists and fans – and why those contributions have been left buried for so long.
results.title: Rock Out

results.overview: After his grandmother's funeral, Paulinho returns to his hometown. A misunderstanding sets him on a journey to find a lost photography.

results.overview: In one of the harshest places on Earth, three women from different generations chase a hidden and ephemeral world beneath the Antarctic sea ice. Dr Natalie Robinson leads a world-first expedition to McMurdo Sound, joined by microbiologist Jacqui Stuart on her first trip south. Mentoring them from afar is veteran sea ice physicist Professor Pat Langhorne.

results.overview: Charlie, a depressed night manager of a motel, and Bridgette, a young naive woman on the brink of adulthood, engage in late-night conversation, sharing intimate secrets that shift how they see each other.

results.overview: Leo recalls his old love, Joe. He misses him dearly. When Leo imagines Joe being present in his life again, he doesn’t know how to feel. Everything’s the same about him: his eyes, his hair, his lips, and that necklace. The last thing Leo heard was that Joe has a girlfriend now, Juliane. Leo thought he had moved on; it's been a tough two years, but when Leo suddenly starts remembering everything they’ve done together, he doesn’t want this wishful thinking to end.
results.title: HIM

results.overview: In a wasted land, a solitary medic is charged with treating the head of a mysterious organization, soon finding himself in the middle of politic power struggles.

results.overview: A deeply moving story of love and loss set in the northern NSW town of Lismore, Australia’s most flooded postcode and site of the nation’s most costly climate disaster.

results.overview: From the shadows of a Guatemalan neighbourhood scared into silence, two sisters lead a luminous rebellion—unleashing joy, art, and radical truth in a fight for survival.

results.overview: The love story of a Yakut teacher and a Russian school principal, which unfolds against the background of perestroika, at the junction of epochs, when the Yakut people need to reassemble their idea of their history and place in it.

results.overview: Sol falls in love with Lola, a young deaf actress, and they begin a romance. Everything gets complicated when Lola starts living under the same roof as Sol's ex-husband, Miguel. In this curious triangle, they will discover that the death of one love can be the birth of another.

results.overview: Judith, a 40-ish year old hospital clown who lives alone, is increasingly unsettled by Francis, her next-door neighbour, a joyful and invasive retired military. Her suspicions are heightened when disturbing details are discovered about him, leading her to spy everything he does. Lost between paranoia and reality, Judith becomes consumed by her obsession. What is eventually uncovered is far more horrifying than she ever imagined...

Their quest for justice and freedom transforms into a mystical journey, unleashing powerful occult forces.  Based on the short story "Dans la barque" by Geneviève Blouin.

results.overview: As her wedding day approaches, Cantika (21) sets out to find her estranged biological  father, only to uncover a shocking truth: her father, long kept hidden by her late  mother, has transitioned into a woman named Dewi (41). As Cantika and Dewi navigate  the complexities of their past and present, they must confront deep-seated wounds  and attempt to rebuild a relationship fractured by time and secrets.

results.overview: A global bitcoin documentary by David Kuhn and Lauren Sieckmann.
results.title: Unbanked

results.overview: Set at an idyllic summer literary retreat, Homolita is an erotic comedy about the pratfalls and pitfalls of modern queer dating and the enduring legacy of Vladimir Nabokov's Lolita.

results.overview: A short film that follows two mothers who must navigate their relationship one year after a tragic school shooting turned their worlds upside down. Their painfully awkward encounter surprises them when it leads to a moment of joy and connection over a grilled cheese sandwich.

Could it be that during the trip, Júlia has reconsidered her sexuality? Will Marta dare to find out if there’s something more than friendship between them?

results.overview: Amid December’s festive glow, refugees remain hidden in forests along the Poland-Belarus border. This powerful documentary gives voice to their silent cries.

results.overview: Kennedy’s desire for a heteronormative experience sees her embark on a one-night stand. What could possibly go wrong?

Her twin brother thinks she’s unraveling. As buried memories surface, they must uncover the truth before the past swallows her whole.

results.overview: Just because she arrived three minutes earlier in the world, the elder sister of the twins was separated from the other, and was sent thousands of miles away from home. The elder sister (Chan) was forced to leave their hometown, and struggled for her life in Chengdu. The younger sister (Juan) stayed in their rural hometown and continued her routine life. However, two girls who looked exactly like each other actually pursued distinct paths in two entirely different cities. Their experiences of growing up as women developed in parallel.
results.title: Fate of the Moonlight

results.overview: Chasing Whales is an experimental short documentary film following the journey of the French filmmaker La Fille Renne on the trail of cetaceans, reflecting on our relation to them and the evolution of their hunt in Northern Europe.

results.overview: This playful, expansive trilogy explores the artist’s evolving relationship with Hong Kong as the city undergoes its own upheavals. Reworking the visual language of Asian futurism, some scenes are shot on lush 16mm, immersing viewers in swoony Cantopop and late-night neon; other scenes move away from the nostalgic, stylised world of Wong Kar Wai. Working with actor Ching Ching Ho, Lam deconstructs the fictions of Hong Kong’s screen archive and her own attempts to capture memories of a disappearing homeland. This moving reflection on artmaking in the diaspora draws on collective memories to imagine possible futures.
results.title: The Unshakeable Destiny

results.overview: An enigmatic Cambodian-Australian puppeteer’s life begins to unravel during a TV performance. Can he be vulnerable to his young daughter about the genocide he fled?
results.title: Interview With A Hero

results.overview: Just because she arrived three minutes earlier in the world, the elder sister of the twins was separated from the other, and was sent thousands of miles away from home. The elder sister (Chan) was forced to leave their hometown, and struggled for her life in Chengdu. The younger sister (Juan) stayed in their rural hometown and continued her routine life. However, two girls who looked exactly like each other actually pursued distinct paths in two entirely different cities. Their experiences of growing up as women developed in parallel.
results.title: Fate of the Moonlight

results.original_title: The Roaming Center for Magnetic Alternatives
results.overview: The Roaming Center for Magnetic Alternatives follows a mobile archiving center in a cargo trailer as it crosses the Midwest to digitize the VHS tapes of LGBTQ+ folks living in Middle America. In real-time digitizing sessions, people watch their own histories as they are being preserved, and reveal a look into queer life in the Bible Belt since the 1980s. This film takes a road trip through the past into the present, and gives us a glimpse of what an ever-expanding queer archive looks like in the future.
results.title: The Roaming Center for Magnetic Alternatives

results.original_title: If You Should Leave Before Me
results.overview: Mark and Joshua, a married couple, face a devastating loss that strains their relationship. To escape grief, they focus on their unconventional jobs as guides for the recently deceased, leading them to the afterlife.
results.title: If You Should Leave Before Me

results.overview: A shy guy silently falls in love with his straight forward coworker girl.  They need to get the work done at the advertisement agency.  What happens next to these organisms?

results.title: Le bonheur est une bête sauvage

results.overview: Food Delivery captures the valiant efforts of the Filipino fishermen, Coast Guard and Navy to deliver desperately needed food to communities, all while defending their livelihoods and national sovereignty in the contested West Philippine Sea. results.overview: Asian-Australian Wen is in for a surprise when she tags along to Chinese New Year lunch with Aunty Poh and her friends... The Aunties take the honour of fighting to pay the bill very seriously. When limbs start flying, Wen and Aunty Poh come to terms with the importance of friendship and family.

results.overview: Experience three parallel lives of an Indigenous man in Naarm (Melbourne) – in each instance, we ponder if he will always be made to feel like an outsider in his own land.

results.overview: A group of sex workers and brothel youth form a film production house in the Kalighat redlight area, Kolkata, India. Despite the opposition from the conservative society, they are determined to become filmmakers, resist prostitution among the second generation, survive through the art of cinema, and aspire to transform the redlight area into a professional film colony in the post-pandemic time.

results.overview: Aadharsh spends the entire day anticipating a call or message from Meghana, growing restless as the silence lingers. When she finally calls late at night, their long-awaited conversation takes a subtle but tense turn. Emotions simmer beneath the surface, and the moment quietly unravels into conflict. As misunderstandings grow, one question remains—can their bond withstand the strain?
results.title: Unnai Kaanadha Naan

results.overview: EVOL is a gripping tale of dreams, resilience, and love. Elijah, a Black British rapper, once tasted the sweetness of minor success but now finds himself living out of his car, clinging to the fragments of his ambition. Despite the hardships, his devoted girlfriend Lauren remains his anchor, encouraging him to pursue his passion for music. Together, they hatch a bold plan to leave the struggles of London behind and chase a brighter future in Atlanta, the vibrant heart of hip-hop. Will Elijah find his voice in a new land, or will the weight of his past hold him back? EVOL is a raw and intimate exploration of ambition, sacrifice.
results.title: EVOL

results.original_title: UFC on ABC 8: Hill vs. Rountree Jr.
results.overview: UFC on ABC 8: Hill vs. Rountree Jr. (also known as UFC on ABC: Hill vs. Rountree Jr) was a  mixed martial arts event produced by the Ultimate Fighting Championship that took place on June 21, 2025, at the Baku Crystal Hall in Baku, Azerbaijan.
results.title: UFC on ABC 8: Hill vs. Rountree Jr.

results.original_title: Coming to a Theatre Near You
results.overview: As the staff close a theatre after hours, their work takes a disturbing turn.
results.title: Coming to a Theatre Near You

results.overview: A daughter uncovers her mother's radical journey from rural South Africa to exile, and how storytelling can become a weapon of resistance and a tool of healing.
results.title: And She Didn't Die

results.original_title: El Punto Cúlmine: Más Allá del Secreto
results.overview: An in-depth look at the creative process of 'The Culminating Point' with the cast, crew, and director Florencia Dufou.
results.title: The Culminating Point: Unveiling The Secret

results.overview: While tirelessly advocating for others, Susan Suchan navigates a cruel life predicament, and secretly devises an unorthodox plan to control mortality.
results.title: Susan

results.original_title: The Most Ordinary Morning on Dizengoff Square
results.overview: A single morning in Tel Aviv - March 5th, 2024 - unfolds in glimpses, revealing the soul of a city through stillness and movement.
results.title: The Most Ordinary Morning on Dizengoff Square

results.overview: This intimate journey about self-acceptance follows Ricardo, a 24-year-old man born with Treacher Collins Syndrome, who has struggled to pronounce the letter R since birth.
results.title: The Broken R

results.overview: A bookshop owner's prosaic life changes when he is reunited with a friend with whom he shared the love for films.
results.title: Are You Open?

results.overview: A petty crook and his girlfriend discover a rare antique plate priced at £60 in an antique shop. As they rush to buy it, they face unexpected competition. Will they get the plate or miss out?
results.title: All Ears

results.overview: An awkward high school student named Jimmy pretends to be a talk show host to socialize with people. Can he maintain his persona after asking out Chloe, the captain of the volleyball team?
results.title: My Next Guest

results.overview: On Halloween, a horror fan ventures into the Maze - but what begins as harmless fun quickly turns into a nightmare. A dark force awakens and evil approaches. Can she escape or will she remain trapped in the maze forever?
results.title: The Maze

results.overview: Marta and Levi deal with grief after a mysterious loss.
results.title: Bazooka

results.overview: Gobi, a young disposable cup, is tossed into a very hostile universe. An urban jungle, populated by strange creatures: rubbish.
results.title: Ordures

results.overview: Whilst on a date, Pete’s ego is tested when a cocky rival challenges him to a pool game, forcing him to decide if winning is worth losing what truly matters.
results.title: Rack 'Em Up

results.overview: after an aspiring filmmaker commits suicide, their family attempts to recreate the movie they dreamt of making
results.title: Odd Short Explode!

results.original_title: That Orchestra with the Broken Instruments
results.overview: A broken string, fractured echo chamber, rusting valves. 100 musicians meet for four days of rehearsals. They speak different languages. Their instruments are broken.
results.title: That Orchestra with the Broken Instruments

results.overview: The dacha is a religion. The dacha is an art. The dacha is a kind of time machine, once you get into it, you return to the most carefree moments of life. In its depths you can find real artifacts: from the magazine "Youth" to vintage clothes from all corners of the planet. What makes up the amazing dacha world? And why is it so important?
results.title: Дача-Культ

results.overview: Nima Shirali’s subtly humorous film follows a community tucked between Uganda’s Katwe Salt Lake and a national park. Through the eyes of an enthusiastic teacher, a jaded caretaker and a sharp-witted mother, the salt lake is seen as a vital lifeline. Between harvests and floods, the lake transforms from a role that is central to local identity and offering a promising industry, to become a symbol of failed development. The low price of salt adds to the woes of toxic labour conditions. And yet, for many in Katwe it remains the only path of opportunity. As a flamboyant, retro-styled local politician pushes grand plans onto a crumbling mine and community, the local population reflects on what the future holds.
results.title: Katwe

results.overview: A school detainment goes array when local Corpus is not who he seems.
results.title: The Entity

results.original_title: The Roaming Center for Magnetic Alternatives
results.overview: The Roaming Center for Magnetic Alternatives follows a mobile archiving center in a cargo trailer as it crosses the Midwest to digitize the VHS tapes of LGBTQ+ folks living in Middle America. In real-time digitizing sessions, people watch their own histories as they are being preserved, and reveal a look into queer life in the Bible Belt since the 1980s. This film takes a road trip through the past into the present, and gives us a glimpse of what an ever-expanding queer archive looks like in the future.
results.title: The Roaming Center for Magnetic Alternatives

results.overview: After the previous documentaries 'Kees vliegt uit' and 'Het beste voor Kees', Videoland is making another documentary about Kees Momma (59). In 'Kees really flies out', viewers will see him spread his wings from June 11.
results.title: Kees vliegt écht uit

results.overview: As a boy, the director was sure about it: his uncle Massimo and Lucio Dalla were the same person. In the film he explores that impossible similarity, complicated and remarkable, which helped him understand his uncle’s disability. As he observes his daily life, Lucio Dalla comes back, singing of loneliness, anger, and freedom.
results.title: What Happines

results.original_title: Para vivir. El implacable tiempo de Pablo Milanés
results.overview: Many recognize and admire the work and voice of Pablo Milanés. Few know the story of how he became an emblematic figure of Cuba and Latin America.This is a portrait of the artist, the battles he had to fight and the complex time he went through and how he enriched it with his singing.
results.title: PARA VIVIR: The Implacable Times of Pablo Milanés

results.overview: Abstract painter Jacque Beckside found unprecedented success for a reason he wasn’t ready for. After a five-year creative dry spell, his associates are begging him to start painting again.
results.title: A Whole Artist

results.overview: A living cultural monument: a love letter to the legendary St. Petersburg House of Radio, which has served as a place of power for people of art for decades.
results.title: Дом радио

results.overview: Chef Heston Blumenthal explores the impact bipolar disorder has had on his life, his creativity and the people he loves.
results.title: Heston: My Life with Bipolar

results.overview: Found footage film about Soviet holiday rituals
results.title: Holidays

results.overview: A meditative 3D animation, rich with texture and the ambiance of the natural world, that beckons us to find solace in turbulent times.
results.title: Moment

results.original_title: El monaguillo, el cura y el jardinero
results.overview: An altar boy and a gardener decide to break a long and painful silence by denouncing the Catholic priest who abused them as minors. This unprecedented incident in Costa Rica causes the priest to flee, becoming a fugitive from the law and Interpol. The young people unite to find him. Will justice be served this time?
results.title: El monaguillo, el cura y el jardinero

results.overview: Come back and revisit Anchor Bay's Better Call Al and Breaking Broadcast in one full experience. This is an abridged/parody PG version of Better Call Saul and Breaking Bad.
results.title: Breaking Al

results.overview: Two lives, two lines, two friends… Olga and Fabiana are exactly that. Two close companions navigating a world where they seek approval from men to feel accepted—only to be weighed down by guilt afterward. Can they save the world while completely out of it? They certainly believe so. A tribute to those rare, sharp moments of clarity that strike when everything else is a blur.
results.title: The Holy Gram

results.overview: A mother and her son use the same video tapes to record themselves in parallel timelines, overlapping different impressions of the world. Images from the 1990s reveal to us a world still failing to solve the same old problems.
results.title: Self-portrait at 13

results.overview: In New Zealand’s heartland, teams of aspiring female rugby players must shatter glass ceilings both on and off the field to achieve their improbable dream of international glory.
results.title: No Tears on the Field

results.original_title: Sam Nzima: A Journey Through His Lens
results.overview: Going behind the lens, Sam Nzima’s life unfolds against one of history’s most recognised photographs, the haunting image of Hector Pieterson during the 1976 Soweto Uprising. Through the events surrounding June 16, 1976, the film chronicles Nzima’s life, from his early days in rural Transvaal to his rise as a key figure in South African journalism, at the frontlines of media that forever changed the political landscape of South Africa.
results.title: Sam Nzima: A Journey Through His Lens

results.overview: JHN EXCLUSIVE: RED (2025) is the 1st official commercial dance album or film from Jacob Hollingsworth Network Corporation.  This project consists of colors, flavors and dynamics for people of differing backgrounds to enjoy. From the ballads of movement on dances like 'In the End', to the alternative rhythms on pieces like 'Same is the Same'. The objective is to open eyes as to how our own social constructs are simply man-made.  Jacob shares a "not so obvious" story about his life through movement and concepts fitting for artists of varying walks of life to dive and dig into. Dances like 'Parody' shows a true side of Jacob that hits close to home with dynamic concepts of his independence. While 'For the Brave' concludes a laboring triumph.  Jacob hopes that the audience can see a truthful side of him and his story in the work.
results.title: JHN Exclusive: Red

results.overview: JHN EXCLUSIVE: RED (2025) is the 1st official commercial dance album or film from Jacob Hollingsworth Network Corporation.  This project consists of colors, flavors and dynamics for people of differing backgrounds to enjoy. From the ballads of movement on dances like 'In the End', to the alternative rhythms on pieces like 'Same is the Same'.
